strIntroduction:
One of the best ways to explore Singapore is to feel the wind in your hair.

Get on a bicycle and explore Singapore's best sights and sounds in this bustling tropical metropolis. A proud city in a garden, you will find lush greenery everywhere you go in Singapore. Be amazed by the magnificent architecture of the Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade on the Bay or more affectionately known as the 'Durian', for its similar appearance to a favorite local fruit. Visit the famous Merlion, a half lion half mermaid mythical creature, and look up at the world's tallest observatory wheel, the Singapore Flyer. Ride along Helix Bridge and catch a glimpse of the beautiful city skyline and check out the floating platform, a large performing venue in the middle of the water.

If you love photography and architecture, this trip is only beginning to get more exciting. Head to Gardens by the Bay to see a perfectly manicured garden built on the principles of environmental sustainability and have a look at the Marina Barrage, a spectacular dam and also Singapore's fifteenth reservoir providing water storage, flood control and recreation.

The beauty of Singapore is that there is so much to see and do in a small island so you never have to travel very far for the good stuff. Hopping from attraction to attraction is such a breeze and even breezier on a bicycle!
strTitle: Discover Marina Bay by Cycling

strIntroduction:
Take a breather from the bustling metropolis of Singapore and visit the urban oasis of Gardens by the Bay. It showcases over 500,000 species of plants and won the International Garden Tourism Award 2016. There are two sections worth visiting--the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest.

First, wander around The Flower Dome. It copies the climate of different countries like South Africa, California, Italy, and some parts of Spain. It won the 2015 Guinness World Record holder for being the largest glass greenhouse. A 1.2 hectares dome, it is divided into gardens such as South American, Californian and Succulent, Baobabs and Bottle Trees, Australian, South African, Mediterranean Garden and Olive Grove. 

Next stop is the Cloud Forest which has plants from tropical highlands up to 2,000 metres above sea level. It has a 35-metre tall mountain and the world’s tallest indoor waterfall. You can take the lift to go to the top of the mountain and have an aerial view of the tree canopy and mountainside. There are several parts of the Cloud Forest: Lost World, Cloud Walk, The Cavern, Waterfall, View Crystal Mountain, Tree Top Walk, Earth Check, and +5 Degrees Secret Garden.
strTitle: Gardens by the Bay E-ticket

strIntroduction:
Go on an imaginative and artistic exploration at the Singapore’s Trick Eye Museum. The theme park offers six family-based zones, you and your family and friends could bond together and share a day of fun and entertainment in the integrated entertainment centre. 

You can execute your creative poses at the following theme: the World of Masterpieces, the Safari Kingdom, the Star of Circus, the Dreams of Fairy Tale, the Love in Winter, and the Adventure Discovery. The museum also exhibits original artworks and popular art pieces replicated from the South Korean gallery. There are great works like the Angel’s Wings, the Moon over the Sky, and the Human Cannonball.

An excellent place to spend a hilarious and easy day, this new attraction will let you unleash your creativity and create good memories with your family and friends.
strTitle: Admission to Trick Eye Museum (E-voucher)

strIntroduction:
This juice cleanse detox provides you with state-of-the-art hydraulic cold-pressed 100% natural, raw, organic fruit and vegetable juices. The program consists of 6 juices and each juice recipe is unique and developed after extensive research. 

This detox provides maximum healthy enzymes, essential vitamins and minimum oxidation to imbue you with all the nutrients that you have been missing out on, and helps to flush out toxins.
strTitle: 3 Day Juice Cleanse Detox Program in Singapore

strIntroduction:
It is always good when one knows how to defend oneself against other people, especially if they're being take advantage of. So whether you're a boy or a girl, this martial arts lesson is for you.

Are you a fan of the Yip Man films? If you are, then you should definitely learn the martial arts of Wing Chun from a local master of his lineage. Understanding Wing Chun will allow you to defend yourself in times of danger, and eventually to even cultivate inner energy and heal internally!

Start your Wing Chun class right away and learn the different techniques including first form, chi-sau, second form, third form, wooden dummy, and zhineng qigong!
strTitle: Martial Arts Workshop: Learn Wing Chun in Singapore

strIntroduction:
In Malaysia, the Sunway Lagoon theme park is Asia’s first Nickelodeon Themed Land. It has more than 90 attractions divided among the Nickelodeon Lost Lagoon, Theme Park Water Park, Amusement Park, Wildlife Park, Extreme Park, and Scream Park. It’s surrounded by the rain forest where you’ll be enthralled by the lost civilization.

At the Nickelodeon Lost Lagoon, meet SpongeBob and his entire gang as you experience the geysers, water cannons, waterfalls, and slides. Get slimed at the Great Slime Deluge as you interact with them. Check out the Kubarango and get ready for the steep drop as you reverse free fall before splashing into the water. Explore the forest as you take in the view of the MariMari Rapids, waterfalls, ponds, gullies, and hills during the short trail course at the Explorers’ Trail. Prepare to slide down to the swimming pools of Vuvuzela from 11 storeys high at the Water Park. Get ready for an adrenaline rush with every twists and turns of the slide. Also try the world's first Waterplexx 5D where you’ll be greeted by the wind, fog, mist, sprays, and other water effects of the theatre so prepare to get wet.

In Amusement Park, take an exciting walk at the longest pedestrian suspension bridges and savour the reverse view of the world while you spin 360 degrees on the Tomahawk and Pirate’s Revenge. At the Captain Kid’s Playland and Candyland, let the children have fun at the colourful themed playgrounds. Check out the Wildlife Park, an interactive animal-themed attraction where there are almost 150 species of animals from all around the world. Ride the longest Flying Fox at the Extreme Park and have an adrenaline rush as you leap at the Bungee Jump. Let loose of your competitive side as you race at the Go Kart or ride the ATV. Prepare to get scared at the Lynton V. Harris' Scream Park as you enter the horror attractions like the Kevin Hall.
strTitle: 25% Off! Sunway Lagoon One Day Pass to All Parks

strIntroduction:
Bali Safari and Marine Park is a conservation centre that helps in the breeding of endangered species in Indonesia. Some of these endangered species include the komodo dragon and Bali mynah, two of the most popular animals in the centre. This ticket will give you a chance to experience the Safari Journey where you will ride an air-conditioned tram to see zebras, tigers, and lions on an open-range region. A resident hippopotamus and a white rhinoceros named Nelson are also waiting for you here. 

Next, you will see a school of fishes in the park’s Fresh Water Aquarium. There are about 40 species of fishes here including Kalimantan’s super red arowana. Admission to Fun Zone and Water Park is also included on this package. At the Fun Zone you can try different rides such as the Climbing Car, Merry Go Round, Go Go Bouncer, Spinning Coaster, or Jungle Cruise. The Waterpark has two pools and a few water slides that offer a view of the beach. Finally, you will have a seat at the silver zone of Bali Theatre’s Bali Agung Show. The show is about the legend of King Sri Jaya Pangus and Princess Kang Ching Wie.
strTitle: Bali Safari and Marine Park Ticket

strIntroduction:
As a cornerstone of Hong Kong’s sights and attractions, the Ocean Park is a must-visit for any traveller. Bursting with colours and activities in every corner, this theme park promises both the young and old endless fun and entertainment, so grab your tickets and get ready for a whooping good time! 

A dizzying number of activities await you, from the many daily animal shows (that include exotic arctic animals), to animal encounters such as the opportunity to swim with the park’s graceful dolphins and even the opportunity to get up close and personal with Emperor Penguins! 

Up for some thrills? Why not take on the park’s many heart-pumping rides such as the ‘Hair Raiser’ or the ‘The Rapids’ or if you’re game enough, The Abyss Turbo Drop – undeniably the park’s scariest ride at a good 20 floors above ground level!

Feeling a little famished after all that adrenaline-pumping action? Be spoilt for choice by the park’s wide array of dining options that range from Asian to European and of course traditional Hong Kong delicacies, satisfying even the pickiest of eaters. Digest lunch with a scenic cable car ride from one end of the park to another, or with a leisurely stroll amongst the park’s many gift shops that are perfect for picking up a little souvenir or two (p.s we recommend Goods of Desire – traditional cultural gifts with a quirky modern twist!)  

Think theme parks are just for kids? Well, with a visit to this one, you’ll never feel the same way about having fun again.
strTitle: Hong Kong Ocean Park E-Ticket

strIntroduction:
Lego is an all-time favourite of children and you can fully experience it at LEGOLAND in Johor Bahru. It is open for children and adults. It's the first ever constructed LEGOLAND in Asia. You can learn about building blocks at the Lego Academy and Build and Test. The Observation Tower is an observation deck that you can ride as it goes up and down in a slow circular motion. It has a great view of the theme park. You can go down slides at the Duplo Play Town and go to a farm or hospital. Ride the Project X and the Dragon's Apprentice rollercoasters. Go inside a castle and let the dragon take you for a ride.

Explore the Lost Kingdom and be a hero as you use lasers to search for lost treasure. At the Dino Island, prepare to get wet as you ride the dinosaur as it goes down water from the peak of the volcano.  You will witness a meet and greet and story telling at the Castle Stage.

At the Build-A-Raft, you can create rafts made of Lego as you swim in the lazy river surrounded by plants and flowers. It is a thrilling ride as you go down the tube slides straight into the pool at the Twin Chasers. Use your building skills at Build-A-Boat by building small boats and testing them on water by racing with other boat builders.
strTitle: Summer Holidays 11% Off! To LEGOLAND Malaysia E-Ticket

strIntroduction: Devdan is derived from the Sanskrit “Deva” and “Dhana” which means “God’s Grace”. This show shows the uniqueness of the different culture found in Indonesian islands namely Bali, Java, Sumatra, Borneo and Papua. This 90-minute show features costumed actors and actresses who perform acrobatics and dances that will introduce you to the culture of the different islands of Indonesia. You will see the Lesung dance in the Bali act, the Wayang puppet show in the Java act, the rhythmic movements of the Saman dance in the Sumatra act, the body paintings of the Papua act as well as the aerial skills of the performers in the Borneo act.
strTitle: Summer Holiday 23% Off ! Devdan Show - Bali Nusa Dua Theatre

strIntroduction:
One of the most convenient ways to roam the streets of Hong Kong is via a hop on, hop off double-decker bus. This 24-hour sightseeing tour ticket allows you to explore Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and Stanley at your own pace. Get a glimpse of the country's rich history as you visit the best attractions and landmarks one-by-one. 

Ride the tram to Victoria Peak, Hong Kong's highest peak at 1,811 feet and the perfect spot to view the iconic skyline. Pay a visit to Man Mo Temple, one of the oldest traditional-style temples dedicated to the gods of literature and martial arts, then make a side trip to the busy Central Stanley Market, where you can purchase branded clothing and typical Chinese souvenirs. Located nearby is Repulse Bay, the crescent-shaped beach that is frequented for early morning strolls or sunset sessions. Witness how old traditions marry modernity through a sampan ride at the thriving Aberdeen Village, and likewise catch a Star Ferry cruise along Victoria Harbour for front-row seats to Hong Kong's signature skyline. In every attraction that you'd stop over, you will be able to learn about the colonial history of Hong Kong through recorded commentaries available in 10 different languages.
strTitle: Hop-on Hop-off Big Bus Premium Tour around Hong Kong

strIntroduction:
Action-packed moments are sure to occur when you head to Lost World of Tambun with this ticket. It's Malaysia's premier destination, and you're going to enjoy it to the fullest.

Upon arrival, let the rides and the natural attractions give you a wonderful time. The Water Park is where you can cool off after experiencing the dense heat of the ancient rainforest. At the Amusement Park, feel the rush as you try one the many thrilling rides. If you're travelling with a group, then the visit to the Adventure Park is sure to be unforgettable. You and your friends will learn to work as a team in the competitive exercises. On your visit to the Petting Zoo, be fascinated by over 55 species of animals. Apart from seeing the creatures up-close, you're also going to learn more about them. Another wildlife encounter is what you can expect when you reach the Tiger Valley. Meet the Siberian Tigers and be mesmerised by their agility, strength, and power. For some history lesson, proceed to the Tin Valley. Find out how tin mining played a huge role in building the city of Ipoh. The artefacts are guaranteed to astound you. Lastly, drop by the Hot Springs and Spa for a rejuvenating experience in the hot mineral springs. 

It's a nature trip that will you remember for a very long time. Enter the Lost World of Tambun now.
strTitle: Family Deal: Ticket to Lost World of Tambun Theme Park

strIntroduction: You will be picked-up from your hotel in District 1 by an air-conditioned minivan and taken to Cu Chi Tunnels, an underground city stretching over 200 kilometres from Ho Chi Minh City to the Vietnamese-Cambodia border. During the Vietnam War, the tunnels served as the hideout and command centre of the Vietnamese soldiers. On the surface, you will see the tanks and weapons and watch a documentary film about the subterranean city. Then you will squeeze and walk through the tunnels for about an hour to see the rooms, kitchens, warehouses, and bunkers. Before returning to your hotel, you will try out tapioca and tea and visit a rice paper workshop.
strTitle: Cu Chi Tunnels Tour with Two-way Transfer

strIntroduction:
From the magnificent caves to the beautiful hills, Guilin is unquestionably a good place for sightseeing. No need to wait long, this tour is going to bring you to its most eye-catching sites.  

The fantastic Reed Flute Cave consists of colourful lights, which highlight the spectacular stalactite, stalagmite and pillar formations. Explore the cave and be in awe all throughout. Fubo Hill Park is where you can see visually-stunning pavilions, cloisters, stone carvings, Buddha statues and mineral formations. It also provides the best view of Guilin. For the last stop, visit Elephant Trunk Hill and let the unique rock formation dazzle you.  

So, are you just going to stare at the television or computer screen forever? Go out and see something new. Come and enjoy the sights of Guilin now.
strTitle: 1 Day Tour of the Best Sites in Guilin, China

strIntroduction: This pass will give you a full day access to Waterbom Bali Waterpark’s 21 waterslides including the Python, Pipeline, and the Lazy River. The park is situated in a tropical garden in the middle of the Kuta stretch. There are several categories for the rides such as mellow, moderate, and extreme. The Lazy River is a mellow ride in which you will drift along the tube raft to cascading waterfalls. The Python is where three people will be placed in a circular tube and will travel six meters into the splash pool. Finally, you can try the extreme 20-metre-high ride called the Pipeline where you will slide through twists and turns to reach the end.
strTitle: Summer Holiday 16% Off ! Waterbom Bali One-day Pass

strIntroduction:
Experience a spectacular night show outdoors, the Wings of Time, with the open sea as your backdrop at Siloso Beach Wings of Time Theatre. Witness it with the latest multimedia effects of 3D projection mapping, state of the art lasers, robotic water fountains, giant water jets, and pyrotechnics. The story unfolds with Shahbaz; a mystical pre-historic bird, and his friends, Rachel and Felix; as they travel across various beautiful landscapes and through the mysteries of different times. 

It will take you through the time of the British Industrialisation Revolution, the Silk Road era, Mayan Pyramids, Underwater World, and African Savanna. Throughout this journey, they all discover more about themselves. Will Shahbaz find his home? Can a boy and a girl find true friendship? Find out how it all plays out as as you watch the Wings of Time.

Book a pair of tickets to enjoy a special 40% discount!
strTitle: Wings of Time E-Voucher

strIntroduction:
If your type of adventure is to thrill, this trip will satisfy your thirst for it! So mum and dad, pack up and treat your kids for a fun filled day in the most largest safari park and amusement park in China!

Step into the world of safari! Drive through the giant pandas, koalas and white tigers living in communities in which they can breed harmoniously. The Chimelong Safari Park is the first park in China to introduce a self-drive tour that allows the guests to view over 20, 000 animals while driving their own car around the area that stretches nearly one million square meters in total. After your adventurous exploration, you and your children can watch the world's most enchanting white tiger performance and three other famous animal performances. 

Brace yourself for the 70 rides that await you in the largest amusement park in China! It is only in Chimelong Paradise, where you can find the Dive Coasters and two Ten Inversion roller coasters and eight world record-holding rides including Dive Coaster, Ten Inversion Roller Coaster, Motorbike Launch Coaster, Young Star Roller Coaster, Half Pipe, Splash Battle, Stunt Show, Giant Frisbee and the world’s most advanced 4D Theater. If you're done with the thrilling rides, cool down and be amazed by the Lumberjack Show. The whole family will also surely enjoy the magic shows and parades with 200 performers from 20 countries. 

Be the coolest parents, let this trip be the quality time for you to explore and have fun with your kids.
strTitle: Couple Offer - Experience the Thrill in Chimelong Paradise and Safari Park in Guangzhou, China

strIntroduction:
If you find it hard to relax in the big city, then you should definitely take a trip to the islands. Come and join this memorable tour of Samal Island. Inhale the fresh air, enjoy the view and have a wonderful time at the beach.

The cruise to Samal Island gives you a panoramic view of Davao City and the beautiful Mount Apo. Listen to the harmonious sound of the soft waves while you stare at the scenery. Arrive at the beach and go for a nice swim in the blue water or just unwind on the white sand. Whatever you choose, you’re guaranteed to have a blissful feeling.

In short, Samal Island is paradise. You used to dream about it but thanks to this tour, it’s about to turn into reality.
strTitle: Couple Offer - 1 Day Cruise through Paradise: A Tour of Samal Island from Davao, Philippines

strIntroduction:
Experience riding a British Aerospace certified hot air balloon as it flies over Bagan in Myanmar during sunrise. Bagan is known also as the Bagan Archaeological Zone and a temple town in the Southeast Asian country. Witness a breathtaking view of more than 3,000 temples below, contrasting the plain landscape of Bagan. Gaze at the picturesque views underneath as you go way up high in the sky onboard the hot air balloon. 

You will be fetched from the hotel or guest house early morning onboard an antique bus--which adds more authenticity to the experience. Take it all in as it is not everyday you will experience this kind of activity for 45 minutes to one hour (can be extended depending on the wind conditions). Have a light pre-flight coffee, tea, and other refreshments before departing for this tour up in the skies. You will be given a safety briefing by the pilot before starting the activity. Between 12 to 16 people are allowed per hot air balloon ride. 

You will see the ancient temples built during the 7th century as the hot air balloon cruises pass by the Bagan Archaeological Zone. The view is special as you see it at sunrise with mist fading out around the temples. Check out the renowned temple of Nathlaung Kyaung as it is one of the oldest and only remaining Hindu temples in Bagan. See the Ananda Temple, a Buddhist temple built in 1105 AD during the reign of King Kyanzittha from the Pagan Dynasty. Witness passing by the Irrawaddy River, also known as the Ayeyarwady River, the country's largest river and most important commercial waterway; which flows from north to south. 

After the hot air balloon experience, you will have a light champagne breakfast of fruits and pastries after landing. A flight certificate will be awarded to all participants at the end of the tour. A two way transfer to/from airport to accommodation are included.
strTitle: Hot Air Balloon Experience

strIntroduction:
Bohol has been known globally for its picturesque landscapes including Chocolate Hills, and rich cultural heritage involving ancient churches and other well-preserved structures. It is continuing to capture the hearts of many, especially now that it is able to offer more options for thrill-seeking tourists.

The first of its kind in the area, Chocolate Hills Adventure Park (CHAP) is a playground for kids and kids at heart, where guests can experience nature and the thrill of world-class rides at the same time. One of the most popular attractions at CHAP is the Bike Zip, located 150 feet above the ground. All you need to do is to hop on a bike attached to a cable, and feel the thrill as you pedal your way across the zip line. 

If you're looking for a different kind of adrenaline rush, this activity is definitely a must-try!
strTitle: Couple Offer - Feel the Rush: Extraordinary Zipline Adventure in Bohol, Philippines

strIntroduction:
The Skyluge in Sentosa Island is the first-ever Luge introduced in Southeast Asia, offering 2 unique type of experiences, the Luge and Skyride.

Luge is a fun-filled gravity thrill ride which is safe for all ages. With a unique braking and steering system, you can choose to take a leisurely cruise or race down the 688 metre Dragon trail or 628 metre Jungle trail – 1.4 kilometres of fun day and night. The experience is never complete without the Skyride. Board the Skyride for a scenic bird’s eye view of Sentosa Island, Singapore city Skyline and South China Sea.

In celebration of the Summer School holidays grab our discount when you book now!
strTitle: Summer School Holidays 30% off! Luge and Skyride Experience

strIntroduction:
Leave behind the hustle and bustle of the soaring metropolitan Abu Dhabi and go to the heart of the Emirati lifestyle, the desert. 

Enjoy a thrilling 4WD drive in the desert dunes, hop aboard the ship of the desert, enjoy the daily blessing of the Bedouins, a desert sunset and relish a delicious barbecue dinner with the starry sky and live entertainment to enhance your experience.
strTitle: Evening Desert Safari in Abu Dhabi (Bus Pick-up)

strIntroduction:
Visit an ancient world famous temple and explore a town that lives for its pottery. This tour will provide you with many intriguing cultural and traditional highlights within the Sanxia region. Who knows, maybe you will go back home with a self-made piece of pottery.

First you will visit the well known Zushi Temple which is famous for its outstanding classical temple arts that is manifested in its modern reconstruction work - that makes it unique among all the Chinese temples of the world. Exquisite carvings and its complex structure attract tourists from all over the world. After that you will explore the colorful Old Street in Sanhsia.

Next stop will be the pottery town Yingge. There you will find hundreds of pottery plants and can stroll around countless pottery shops. Visit a pottery factory and its showroom and spot an old square coal-fired kiln chimney. If you are happen to travel in October you can experience the exciting Yingge Ceramics Festival.

Enjoy a day of many amazing cultural experience!!
strTitle: Yingge and Sanxia Afternoon Folk Arts Tour, Taipei, Taiwan

strIntroduction:
Agra the zenith of art that enshrined romance is the town that lives mainly in the past. Once the seat of the Mughal rulers, the passion for building endowed it with one of the loveliest structure in the world – the Taj Mahal.  

Join this day tour to visit this magnificent creation that looking at it is like stepping out of the poster card.  Your tour also take you the Agra Fort from where you can get the most moving view of the Taj on its little octagonal tower that lies across the river Jamuna. You will also see Sikandra, the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Akbar.  

A travel like no other, this trip to Agra could be your best excursion ever.
strTitle: 1 Day Journey to Visit the Taj Mahal at the Romantic City of Agra from Delhi, India

strIntroduction:
The National Orchid Garden is found inside the country's first UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Singapore Botanic Gardens. It houses more than 1,000 species and 2,000 hybrids of orchids separated into four zones. The Spring zone displays orchids with the different shades of gold, yellow and cream. The Summer zone has bright reds and soft pinks. The Autumn zone displays matured shades while the Winter zone has the white and violet orchids. You will see the Vanda William Catherine orchid, named after Prince William and Princess Catherine.

Check out Tan Hoon Siang Mist House which is a mist house where rare orchids are seen. Also visit The Cool House which is a smaller version of the Gardens by the Bay. The low temperature simulate  the temperature of high altitude tropical forests. It displays orchids that are found in higher places with colder climates. Apart from orchids, you will also see the venus flytrap, sundew and pitcher plant. You will also see the crane fountain, golden cage display and golden shower arches inside the orchidarium. The late Lee Kuan Yew opened The National Orchid Garden in 1995.

The best time to go is now! Enjoy the summer holidays at Botanic Gardens with our Great Singapore Sale Discount!
strTitle: Great Singapore Sale 20% off! National Orchid Garden Ticket

strIntroduction: The Gili islands are known for its snorkeling venues and a wide variety of marine life. In this tour, you will be fetch in your hotel accommodation before traveling to the Gili Islands to  see a diverse marine life while snorkeling. You will then ride a boat to Gili Meno and Gili Air. Gili Meno is known as the island set in the middle of Gili Air and Gili Trawangan and is the smallest among the three islands. Gili Meno Wall is found here and is often inhabited by turtles and giant Gregorian fans that hangs on to the corals. Then you will visit Gili Air which is where you will find manta rays, flying gunards, frogfish and pipefish. You will also encounter the Gili Air wall which is home to plenty of lionfish and occasionally, seahorses.
strTitle: Snorkeling in Gili Meno and Gili Air

strIntroduction:
Experience some of Osaka's most iconic sights when you join this one day walking tour! See both the traditional and modern sides of Osaka with visits to the Floating Garden Observatory and the Osaka Castle. End the journey with an exciting riverboat cruise where you can enjoy breathtaking views of the city!

If you’re planning a trip to Osaka soon, make sure you don’t miss this chance to explore!
strTitle: 1 Day Walking Tour to See Osaka Castle and Floating Garden

strIntroduction: From Hanoi, you will be picked-up from your hotel in the Old Quarter and taken to the pier for a one-day Halong Bay cruise. The bay is home to over 2000 limestone islands and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You will board in a brand new boat built with robust steel. After trying out Vietnamese dishes for lunch at the boat's air-conditioned restaurant, you will continue moving along the turquoise water to see the islands and floating villages. Then you will visit Thien Cung Cave, which is also known as Heaven Cave. Not only will you see the numerous stalactites and stalagmites but you will learn about the legends behind them. You will also have time to relax on board and savour the tranquil atmosphere.
strTitle: Halong Bay Cruise with Thien Cung Cave Tour

strIntroduction:
On this activity, you will learn how to cook Khmer dishes. The class will begin with a trip to a local market so you can get the ingredients on the list provided to you by your host. These ingredients include locally-produced herbs and spices, which according to CNN, makes Khmer cuisines tastier.

After your trip to the market, you will start cooking. With the guidance of a local chef, you will prepare a total of five dishes. These dishes may include any of the following depending on the day of your cooking class: Khmer Pumpkin Soup, Beef Lok Lak, Fish Amok, Deep Fried Rice Noodle Salad, Pineapple Curry Soup, Mango Chicken Salad and Khmer Spring Rolls. After cooking, you will proceed to have lunch with your host.
strTitle: Traditional Khmer Cooking Class and Market Tour

strIntroduction:
Kyoto is quite an interesting place to visit as it used to be the emperor's residence from 794 until 1868. It is a historical place where temples and shrines survived during the World War II. The city was spared from cities targeted for atomic bombs and air raids during that time. Currently Kyoto is the seventh largest city that is modernized.

First stop is the Kinkaku-ji Temple, a zen temple with two floors on top that are entirely covered in gold leaf. It used to be the retirement villa of the shogun Ashikaga Yoshimitsu, which became a zen temple of the Rinzai sect after his death. See overlooking from the temple a large beautiful pond. Though it has burned down quite a number of times throughout centuries, it was still rebuilt in 1955.

Afterwards, visit Ginkakuji Temple which was built by the Japanese shogun Ashikaga Yoshimasa as his retirement villa on the grounds of today's temple. It was inspired by Kinkaku-ji Temple, which was his grandfather's retirement villa. After he passed away, the villa was converted into a zen temple. Since Yoshimasa was an art aficionado, you will also see how the arts and culture developed during his time through the tea ceremony, Noh Theater, poetry, landscaping, and architecture. There are also the Silver Pavilion, other temple buildings, a moss garden, and a unique dry sand garden. Take a stroll along the circular route at the grounds of the temple. 

Last stop, Kiyomizudera Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage Site which literally means pure water temple and one of the most celebrated temples of Japan. It is located on the site of the Otowa Waterfall and its name was derived from waterfall's pure waters. You will see its popular wooden stage jutting out from its main hall, which is 13 meters above the hillside below. Explore the beautiful view of the cherry and maple trees below. Check out also the small statue of the eleven faced, thousand armed Kannon. English, Chinese, and Korean audio guides will be available on the bus.
strTitle: Kinkaku-ji, Ginkakuji, and Kiyomizudera Temples Tour

strIntroduction:
Food, glorious food! If you are passionate about food, this tour is perfect for you because it's all about food, food, and of course, even more food!

Food will never taste better after embarking on a journey to experience and learn about Chinese food traditions. Start with a visit to a major Shanghai market, New Zhenning Lu Market, and then have lunch in a one of the city's best and most authentic Shanghainese restaurants.

At the market, take a look at how the average Chinese eats. Learn about Guangdong traders, Anhui salt merchants, Fujian stevedores, and Ningbo’s missed opportunity to become eastern China’s major port city. Also get to look at how geography explains Shanghai's reputation as a “land of fish & rice”.

Find out why the Chinese place such importance in sharing meals. Learn why there is an emphasis on freshness and vegetables, and texture in cooking. Listen to a local's take on China's troubles with food scares and how Communism has affected cuisine in the 20th century and today.

Did you know that China is is the only country in the world with a strategic pork reserve? That's how important pork is in the Chinese diet. Uncanny how the Chinese character for ‘home’ is actually a pig with a roof over its head!

Lunch will be served at a local Shanghainese restaurant located in a colonial-era villa. There, you will meet with one of the most interesting chefs in Shanghai today, Tony Lu. Tony will carefully curate your meal, choosing a selection of courses that illustrate some of the concepts we've discussed along the way.

Indulge in mouth-watering dishes like Xunyu, a famous Shanghai smoked fish recipe, hongshao rou, a succulent and melting red-braised pork belly; and cold "drunken chicken," a specialty of Shaoxing that uses the city’s well-known rice wine as a marinade for a steamed free-range bird.

After so much talk about food, are you drooling yet? If you are a food lover, you certainly won’t want to miss this trip!
strTitle: Half Day Food Culture Exploration in Shanghai, China

strIntroduction:

Kick off with a visit to several of the largest markets in the city, such as Scott's Market, otherwise known as the Bogyoke Aung San Market, the Indian Market and the Vegetable and Fruit Market. Let our experienced guides lead you around the colonial area and venture into little gems of hidden sidewalk cafes and street stalls.

After a splendid lunch, hop on a boat to the other side of the Yangon River, where Twante village is located. Travel to the village, an hour-long drive filled with bumps and humps but also jam-packed with interesting sights, particularly those along the famous Twante Canal. Once you arrive at Twante village, a visit to Shwesandaw Pagoda is in order. A series of 5 terraces topped with a cylindrical stupa, the single most important relic found within are the hairs of Gautama Buddha. Next up, take a local trishaw down to the pottery production area of Twante, responsible for the beautiful pottery that Twante is famous for. Watch the locals in action as they spin, mould and create piece after piece of art, wrapping up this fun-filled trip.

strIntroduction:
Angkor Wat is an interesting temple in Siem Reap to see as it is a UNESCO Heritage Site that is quite well known around the world. There is so much history, culture, and architecture to see as you wander around the landmark. Instead of walking, ride a Vespa (an Italian brand of scooter manufactured by Piaggio) for a change with a tour guide to check out the different features of the temple. 

Drive to Angkor Wat early morning so you can witness the breathtaking sunrise at the Lotus Pond, a lily pond which is considered as the best spot they say at the area. Afterwards, while still overlooking the lily pond, devour a classic Cambodian lunch and try some of the Khmer local cuisine favourites.

Next, you will see the Khmer architecture which is evidently present on the walls, sculptures, interiors, and facade of the temple. Let the tour guide share stories behind the intricate carvings; how it was built; and background on Buddhism and Hinduism. You will see also see the bas relief of the Churning of the Seas of Milk and 3,000 beguiling apsaras or heavenly nymphs carved on the walls. 

Afterwards, you will see the central temple is three storeys high. It is where the Gallery of a Thousand Buddhas is which used to hold hundreds of Buddhas before but most were removed or stolen. Now there are only  a few of them left. Also, check out the towers at the second and third storeys since each are decorated on top with lotus bud. At the upper level, the Bakan Sanctuary is located which is open to a limited number of people per day.

Remember to dress modestly when you visit the temple since it is a religious place. Wear covered clothing for the upper arms and shorts until the knees. Tourists are not allowed to touch or sit on the ancient structures and remember to be respectful of the monks wandering around the temple. At the end of the tour, you will be brought back to the hotel in Siem Reap.
strTitle: Test Angkor Wat Sightseeing Tour on a Vespa

strIntroduction:
Learn the art of Batik painting at a hub for art and music lovers in Singapore. Batik painting is a wax-resist dyeing technique applied on cloths by either drawing dots or lines using a spouted tool called canting or by printing the resist with a copper stamp called cap. This tradition of making Batik is commonly found in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines and other Asian countries. 

You will experience a Batik painting class in Singapore with at least eight people in a group. The activity will begin with a 15-minute demo of how Batik is done by an experienced Batik painter. You will see how he magically transforms a black canvass to an eye-catching Batik. Afterwards, you are given 45 minutes to colour your canvass where you may produce various colours by layering one after the other, learn, and enjoy the entire process of making Batik.  You may bring home your very own Batik artwork after the class.
strTitle: Batik Painting Art Workshop

Feel like a kid again and be amazed as you walk through rooms filled with space exploration equipment, and exhibits about the history of flight and astronomy. To date, there are over 85,000 items displayed inside the whole museum—imagine how huge that collection is!

See the capsule of Vostok 1, the spacecraft which Russian cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin used when he returned to Earth from the outer space. As you might have learned from your science or astronomy classes, Gagarin was the first man to journey into the vast galaxy. He contributed a lot to Russia’s space exploration efforts, and was even considered a hero by many.

Another artefact you shouldn’t miss is Sputnik-5, the original cage which was launched into space in 1960 carrying two Soviet dogs named Belka and Strelka. There’s also the Lunokhod, a rolling lunar artefact, used to explore the surface of the moon. 

Whether you are an astronaut wanna-be or just plain curious about what lies in the outer space, here’s your chance to learn new things about Russia's space exploration efforts. Enjoy and have an out-of-this-world experience!

strIntroduction:
Tour Schedule:
06:30 AM - Flight from Sde-Dov Airport Tel Aviv. (Please be in the airport 1 hour before the flight) 
07:30 AM - Pick-up from Eilat Airport and transfer from Eilat to Arava border with our professional crew. 
09:00 AM - Transfer from border to Petra. Transport time approximately 2.3 hours, passing through a vast and comfortable high way ("desert way"), following through a scenic route on the mountain side, and arriving at Petra's historical site.  
11:30 AM - Tour of Petra begins at the entrance to the site. Included in your package is an optional horse-back ride for the first 700 meters of the route (tipping the carrier is required, ranging from 2-5 dollars at your discretion). 
03:30 PM - Lunch at a local authentic restaurant. 
04:30 PM - We begin our return trip towards the border. This route includes a few stops along the way at certain observation points in order for you (the traveler) to enjoy the beautiful landscape Wadi Ram has to offer.  
06:30 PM - Arriving in Aqaba for a Short panoramic tour of the city, depending on our time of schedule, we might consider a walking tour as well. 
07:00 PM - Arrival at border and return to Israeli territory with assistance of our crew, transported back to our primary destination/s in Eilat. 
08:15 PM - Arrival to Eilat Airport. 
09:15 PM - Flight back to Sde-Dov Airport Tel Aviv.
strTitle: One Day Tour to Petra From Tel Aviv, Israel

Next stop is the Boti Falls, which is located in a village called Boti in the Manya Krobo, district of Ghana. This is a twin waterfall which is often referred to as male and female. 

We will also make our way to the Akaa falls, located remotely in Yilo Krobo, district of Ghana. This is also a very mesmerizing fall.

Another place of interest is the Umbrella Rock. This is a set of rocks near the Akaa falls which resembles the shape of an umbrella. You can climb to the top of the rock and get a scenic view of the beautiful forest that lies in front of you.

Walking through, your next stop is the Tsenku Falls. This is located near Dodowa, near the greater Accra district, region of Ghana. Dropping from a height of about a 250 feet, this is a very scintillating waterfall that will calm every visitor.

What truly stands out as very Singaporean is the Tze Char style of communal dining. This is basically the locals of Singapore indulging in some good food with family and friends. 

Tze Char is a Hokkien term used for a local dining experience served by restaurants or eateries in kopitiams. The cuisine is a fusion of local and Chinese delicacies and the prices are affordable. The ambiance is casual and is most often enjoyed in groups during dinner.

Have you ever avoided a local Tze Char place because you are intimidated by it? Don't know what to order when you are there? Gotten conned to order Sweet and Sour Pork by the wise-cracking supposedly English-speaking server taking your order? Don't miss out on enjoying new Singapore cuisines because you are unfamiliar with the food or are apprehensive to try new things.

Join a local foodie host for a weekly dinner experience as he takes you to the best Tze Char spots around Central Singapore! Not only do you get to uncover hidden gems, you will also learn how to order popular dishes using local lingo, and discover Singapore's all-time favourite passion—food!

strIntroduction:

The commercial beers consumed in Rwanda include the famous Primus, the almighty Mützig and the wonderful Amstel. In rural areas however, the Urwagwa is a beer made from fermented juice of bananas that has been mixed with roasted sorghum flour and the most popular one. 

This tour will take you to many complex processes required to make the best quality beer. With the best local beer-makers on your side, you will have an opportunity to  make your own beer using only locally produced ingredients and traditional tools. Book now!

strIntroduction:
Today is totally about a journey awakening your spirituality. First in the morning meet with a Balinese shaman, where he or she will open your spiritual CHAKRA. Chakras are energy points along the central meridian of the body. In sanskrit it means "wheel" or "circle" and is generally used to reference specific energy center along the body. In total there are seven chakra points, although some system include one or two extra. Afterward, join a Blessing and purification ceremony at an old small Balinese temple near the river at Sebatu village, called Dalem Pingit Temple. Walk down many steps towards the river to find the temple located near a bathhouse with a water fall. According to the story the waterfall has been there forever and is believed to cure various diseases (both of medical illness or diseases due to magic). The Guardian of the temple will accompany you to present the offering at the main temple.

Next, visit Gunung Kawi Temple located at Tampak Siring village situated on the Pakerisan river, an archaeological complex carved out of the living rock and dating back to 11th century. Walk down 300+ steps to reach the temple passing by lush jungle and rice terraces. Here with the permit of the temple guardian we will relax and enjoy a meditation in one of the caves nearby. Lunch will be served at a local restaurant in Ubud. We will take you to visit an ashram near Ubud, set in a beautiful garden with ponds and trees overlooking the rice field.  You may have the opportunity to do Yoga session here or join chanting with others for meditation. Later, back to the hotel.

This Via Ferrata is also a historical landmark. During World War I, Italy and Austria competed to create a passage in the Dolomite Mountains that will serve as a supply trajectory. The track became the Via Ferrata after the war.

This activity includes special safety equipment and no rock climbing certifications are required. When you reach the aboveground, you can just enjoy the views or camp out.

strIntroduction:
Cullendulla Nature reserve showcases significant Aboriginal history and incredible marine life in close proximity to the town of Batemans Bay, now best viewed by our Glass Bottom Kayak Tour, Perfect for everyone!

Innovative Glass bottom kayaks have allowed us to design an experience viewing the intricate underwater world and search for stingrays, blue swimmer crabs, schools of fish, octopus, fidler rays and much more.
Often referred to as a “Wildlife adventure” on this tour your main aim is to find as much wildlife as possible as we enter a tidal sand flat system and an age old mangrove system now protected within the Batemans Marine Park Sanctuary Zones. This significant area of sand flat, sea grass beds and mangrove system harbours a vast amount of species and their breeding cycles. The area also has significant cultural heritage for the first Australians, with over 12,000 years of occupation by Yuin people. The word “Cullendulla” is a Durga word, the language spoken by the indigenous people and translates to “Place of Food” in english. The tour will show you why and how the Indigenous people made this their home.

A fun 2.5 hour family friendly tour in stable glass bottom kayaks, with photos and snacks included the perfect way to explore the waterway in this otherwise inaccessible area.

We recommend this as a great guided adventure for everyone, first time kayakers, people who want to relax, families and wildlife lovers enjoy this unique experience.
strTitle: Glass Bottom Kayak Tour

strIntroduction:

A grand adventure that includes everything in our other tours but continues on past Sacred Falls, over the Polynesian Cultural Center, one of Hawaii’s most popular visitor attractions, and the Mormon Temple in Laie.  You’ll also see Turtle Bay, the aquaculture farms and Kahuku Point.  Don’t be surprised if you see humpback 
whales offshore here during the winter months.

The tour continues along the storied North Shore, with a dramatic view of world-renowned surfing spots including Sunset Beach, Pipeline and Waimea Bay.  On your way over Oahu’s Central Plain, you’ll see the Dole Pineapple maze and the “birthing stones” of Hawaiian royalty.  Then, the aircraft will head south through the Kolekole Pass, where Japanese warplanes flew on their date with destiny back in 1941.  You’ll see the Four Seasons and Disney’s Aulani and the Ko Olina Resorts, then fly over the deep draft harbor at Barber’s Point.  

After the flight embark on a catamaran cruise that provides you with a chance to see dolphins up close, but you’ll stay aboard rather than swim with the creatures. The catamaran snorkel adventure tour is more relaxed than the dolphin encounter, but you’ll still have ample opportunity to see gorgeous coral reefs and the colorful fish that inhabit the area. After seeing the dolphins, you’ll visit two snorkel spots including “Turtle Town”, a natural turtle cleaning station. You'll watch the ever friendly green sea turtles gather to get their shells and skin cleaned by algae-eating reef fish.

During the winter months, you may also be treated to the sight of humpback whales, as well as a variety of rays and Hawaiian monk seals.

After all the necessary preparation the excitement will begin on 2 hours fun ride accompanied with ATV guide and will take your ride through the absolutely amazing track and not monotone. You will see rice plantation , bamboo forest,Jungle, river, village and picture square panorama.

Light lunch will be served on the private restaurant after you finish the ride around 12 am 

After lunch around 1 pm, the driver will take you to Ubud Sacred monkey forest and have some great time with hundreds of friendly . Inside the rain forest you also can visit the Holy spring temples and the community temple of Padang Tegal Village. Feel free to feed the monkeys with banana or other fruit right from your hand

The last you will be taken to local coffee plantation to see and learn the abundance coffee and spices to make special organic drink . Here also you can see the process of making the most bizarre coffee in the world called coffee luwak.Coffee luwak is the coffee made from  coffee beans eaten by civet cat, pop out, collect them out, clean, sanitize and process to get the rich flavor coffee. Free tasting of each drink were included on the program.

Tour ends back to your hotel by 4 pm

Meander through the streets and alleys of Yerevan – the capital of Armenia – which houses an array of artefacts and monuments, such as the Erebuni (“Fortress of Blood”) which dates back to 8th Century BC. 

As the crossroad of many historical events, Armenia has had its fair share of tragedies. The Tsitsernakaberd Memorial Park is a museum dedicated to remembering the victims of the 20th century Armenian Genocide. Gain a deeper insight into this event with a tour around the museum, where you will also see an eternal flame burning to remember the victims of the tragedy. 

Over at the Matenadaran, marvel at the repository’s impressive collection of ancient manuscripts, housing jewels such as the first Armenian Bible and the Mugni Gospels, whose first lines of each gospel are scribed with gold.    

Cap off the tour with a visit to the Yerevan Brandy Factory, which produces Armenian brandy of impeccable quality! Learn more about the local brandy’s rich history and accolades, as well as have the opportunity to sample its award-winning brandies which are mellow and velvety in flavour, endowed with accents of chocolate and vanilla. 

Bursting with archaeological marvels and wonders, Armenia is a truly worthwhile place to visit, offering the chance for you to gain a deeper understanding of this beautiful country.

strIntroduction:
Walk through the paths where the Roman gods have trodden. Explore the ruins of the ancient city of Ephesus, located in Selcuk, a small town 30 kilometres away from Kusadasi Port. It was the bustling trade centre during the ancient times and a former religious centre of the early Christians. 
 
Your most comfortable walking shoes will become handy when you join this tour where you will walk through the streets that were designed according to the Hippodamian plan. Here roads transacted each other at right angles and pathways are signed clearly.  You will make your way through the archaeological site easily.

There are the Terrace Houses on the hill, opposite the Hadrian Temple, with six residential units on the lower end of the slope of the Bulbul Mountain. The oldest building dates back into the 1C BC and continued to be in use as residence until the 7C AD. Also called "the houses of rich," here you will have a glimpse of the family life during the Roman period.

Exhibits at the Ephesus Museum are meticulously grouped, rooms have their own theme and are designed according to chronological order of excavation. There is The House Findings Room, The Hall of The Fountain Relics, The Hall of The Funerary Relics, The Hall of Artemis, The Gladiators Section, and etc.

The exploration to the ancient city is the highlight of any trip to Turkey, do not dare miss it!

strIntroduction:
Just a few kilometres away from the city centre is a must-see wildlife sanctuary. Let this tour show you around the stunning Nairobi National Park.

The site is home to over 50 species of mammals and over 400 species of birds. On the game drives, you will have a chance to spot these fascinating creatures. The tour also includes a visit to the animal orphanage, which is located inside the park. Get a close look at how the wounded or orphaned animals are nurtured back to health. Expect to see lions, leopards, cheetahs, warthogs, cranes, antelopes, baboons, and more. 

Complete your Kenya vacation with a half-day nature adventure. Nairobi National Park certainly has something for everyone.
strTitle: Half-day Nairobi National Park and Animal Orphanage Tour

strIntroduction:
Visit the Larco museum in this one of a kind tour today!

The Larco museum houses the legacy of the pre- Inca cultures. Visiting the museum will give you an insight in the heritage and culture of the Inca tribe. Visit the different galleries which showcases the pre- Columbian art. Artifacts and semi precious stones are also displayed in the museum as well. Tour the gardens and eat at the local restaurant found in the museum.

Book this tour now and start your exploration in the Larco museum
strTitle: Larco Museum Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore Saona Island and Altos de Chavon tour.

Visit the Saona Island and see the beautiful beaches and it's clear waters. Swim in the waters and feel the waves touch your skin. Ride on board the Catamaran and set sail on an amazing adventure. Visit the little village of Altos de Chavon while having a spectacular view of the Chavon Riven and the famous amphitheater.

Book now and discover the beauty of Saona Island and Altos de Chavon today!
strTitle: Saona Island and Altos de Chavón Tour

strIntroduction:
Ngorongoro Crater day tour gives you an opportunity to explore the Ngorongoro crater wildlife which containing Wild animals and Human life together that is not interfering each others life naturally, Cultural experience to the Masai tribe who live with Wild animals and still proceeding with their daily activity of keeping cattle.

         There will be an Optional of Visiting the Maasai Village Bomea for Cultural Experience, Clients will be welcomed by the Maasai tribe to explore the Tribes life style and Living activities from the leader of the Clan.
strStyle: Safari,Sightseeing tour,Cultural tour,Nature parks and reserves,Land,Shopping,Wildlife
strTitle: Ngorongoro Crater Day Tour

strIntroduction:
The adventure begins when you board the "River Gully Express" which will pick you up at the cruise terminal or hotel lobby. Drive through the coastal town of Ocho Rios seeing the locals way of life. Continue through the villages of White River and Exchange as we head towards higher elevation. Start experiencing the rainforest of Calia Gully with a decent of a 100 ft to its bottom as we continue towards River Gully.

                Experience one of Jamaica's oldest hydro electric plant. See how wood is used as pipes to carry water "The Black Pipe". Now you are in the rainforest "River Gully" where your adventure becomes epic with the water falls climbing, blue hole jumping and underwater cave exploration at the "Island Gully Falls & Blue Hole". Next travel further into the rainforest to Hidden Beauty Rainforest Oasis to complete the tour. On the way back stop at a local craft market to look at local souvenirs and stop for lunch at one of our local Jerk restaurants.
strStyle: Other attractions,Sightseeing tour,Nature parks and reserves
strTitle: Blue Hole and Fern Gully Rain Forest Adventure Tour

strIntroduction:
What would be much better than a trip to a exciting city and doing nothing but to eat?

We'll convey you to Kumasi City, you will meet your aide in the bustling avenues of Kumasi and he will take you to the best shops in the business sectors for you to devour upon. Eating from these stalls and shops when you are in this part of the world is something that you would not want to miss for anything.

When roaming around in the market, you will see a large variety of food options here from stew, vegetables to juices and shakes. Here, you will get a chance to taste the dishes and recipes that are being prepared everyday since generations. Eating at local food stalls and interacting with the local people is a great way to enhance your experience of this tour. You will also learn how to prepare these dishes from the vendors. It is altogether a different experience to prepare street food.

Next, we take a ride in a shared taxi and head off to the local chef in the Pink Hostel, where you will get a chance to prepare a few dishes on your own. You will learn how to prepare the traditional dishes in Pink Hostel.

You will finish your tour with an understanding of the food and wine culture of the city of Kumasi and we certainly hope that you take some of it with you and spread it out wide.
strTitle: Traditional Dishes Tour in Kumasi, Ghana

strIntroduction:
Come and try out our volcano dirt tracks and be wowed by the single-track, the scenery, lava field, the culture, the temple and friendly Balinese peoples.

This exciting ride will take you to explore track of CALDERA BATUR, where you can watch stunning sunrise and amazing view of three mountains standing together. They are Mount Batur, Mount Agung, and Mount Rinjani This ride will be started from our base located at Toya Bungkah Village at about 05.00. The ride will be passing Songan Village. Continued by challenging track passing crater rim of Caldera Batur. A short stop at the view point of Caldera Batur while enjoying the spectacular sunrise view overlooking Mount Rinjani. Relax and recharge your mind with the beauty of Lake Batur and the amazing view of Mount Batur.

After watching the sunrise and having simple breakfast the ride will be continued toward north passing Belandingan Village. This real challenging ride will be passing valley, river, and rocky track on northern part of Caldera Batur. The ride will be completed at Western Part of Caldera Batur where you can ride your bike on the lava rock and the black sand of Volcano Batur.

This ride will be guided by our qualified dirt bike rider of Bali specialized riding on mountain track. The natural beauty, many types of terrain, easy to challenging tracks, hospitality of rural communities, their openness, their smiles and our attention to them, will ensure you to have a dirt bike tours memories that will be never forgotten in the island of Bali.
strTitle: Volcano Batur Dirt Bike Adventure

strIntroduction:
Leave early in the morning for your expedition to explore the ancient areas of Bali. This tiny village is located between the lake and the outer crater rim of Mt. Batur. It is usually called “Desa Bali Aga” as this village is inhabited by descendants of the original Balinese, the people who pre-date the Hindu Majapahit Kingdom in the 16th century. 

Afterward cross to Trunyan Village and explore on foot, visiting the temple and their ancient trees of myth, and then continue to Trunyan's final sanctuary in a traditional wooden canoe paddled by the locals as they tell you about their rates of passage. When a villages passes away, the people here simply leave the body of the deceased on the ground to decompose naturally, it is said that there is no odour from the dead bodies. The villagers attribute this to the scent of the fragrant ‘menyan’ tree from which Trunyan takes its name – Taru menyan. Next, drive back around the lake to the top of the caldera and then enjoy your lunch with the magnificent view of mount and lake Batur.
strTitle: Bali Aga and Trunyan Expedition

strIntroduction: Seven days on safari also allows you to visit the Serengeti, Tanzania’s most famous and largest national park and one of the most spectacular parks in the world. The “endless plains” cover some 14,763 square kilometers including large plains, short grass plains, kopjes, and lakes. Tarangire is a beautiful park filled with Baobabs and Acacias with a large variety of game such as zebras, elephants, giraffes, and waterbuck. Lake Manyara is ideal for viewing birdlife with over 400 species. Ngorongoro is the largest intact crater in the world abundant with wild game including elephants, rhinos, cheetahs, lions, leopards, and hyenas.
strTitle: 7-Days Private Wildlife Safari and Camping Tour

strIntroduction:
Argentina is world renowned for it’s Dove Shooting. If you don’t have time to spend an entire trip enjoying the sport we can now offer a tailored one day trip to a shooting lodge only 3hrs from Buenos Aires so that you don’t miss out on this incredible experience.

          You’ll be collected and returned from your hotel and driven out to the lodge arriving ready to start shooting at around 9am. You’ll stop for lunch in the field before shooting the rest of the afternoon and then returning to your hotel by around 7.30pm.
strTitle: Dove Shooting in Argentina

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this full-day tour from Antigua or Guatemala City where you will visit Pacaya Volcano, one of the nicest spots and tours to do in Guatemala. Here you will have a nice view of Agua, Fuego and Acatenango volcanoes on the way to the top. 

             You will arrive early and head down the road that leads to the Pacific of Guatemala and then reach the road leading to San Vicente Pacaya, where we take a local guide of the community and begin the ascent to our destination. At the beginning of the road there are several people with horses which the rent for those who find it hard to climb the volcano, for additional cost.

             The Thermal Water circuit helps in temperature changes that improves blood circulation, the heat dilates blood vessels and the cold contracts them which relaxes all the body muscles, and eliminating stress. This is also ideal for people suffering from sciatic nerve pains, tendonitis, arthritis, muscle pains or insomnia problems, and people recovering after an accident or operation
strStyle: Horseback riding,Trekking/Hiking,Rock Climbing,Land,Sightseeing tour,Cultural tour,City hop on-hop off,Community-based Tourism,Nature parks and reserves,Treatment
strTitle: Pacaya Volcano and Hotspring Water Thermal Circuit

strIntroduction:
Make the most of your trip with a day tour in Johannesburg. This tour starts with a morning mini  safari drive at Lion Park with an optional Cheetah interaction. Thereafter you get a lifetime firsthand experience of the South African culture with a visit to a cultural village filled with exciting activities including  some Zulu Gumboot dancing.

           After the tour clients are dropped back at their respective hotel/s.
strTitle: Cultural & Mini Safari Tour in Johannesburg, South Africa

strIntroduction:
Take a half day tour into south region of Bali. The best place in Bali where you can see nice crystal Bali beach, Stunning temple of uluwatu as Backdrop of beautiful sunset, kecak dance performance show and visit Jimbaran home of fresh seafood in Bali 

Depart from your hotel around 2.30 pm, our driver will take you to Padang - Padang beach . These beach located at labuan sait ,Pecatu village. The entrance to the beach to pass through some kind of carved limestone inlet down provide its own nuance. The beach is very famous in the surf community due the size and quality of the wave, and since Julia Roberts from the movie eat, pray and love came here the name of Padang- padang beach became more famous. 

After Padang padang beach the driver will take you to  Uluwatu temple , Uluwatu temple  is an amazing temple located on the high cliff of Pecatu land faced the Indian ocean as background view. The temple represent the Goddess of the sea and worshiped by Hindus people in Bali island. Here also you can see several monkeys who lives in the jungle around Uluwatu. You will be attending on kecak performance dance show start at 6 pm with temples and sunsett as background 

Your last destination around 7.30 pm  is Jimbaran Bay where you can have dinner with the selection of Fresh seafood( at your expenses) which commonly prepared immediately and generally grilled over a fire of coconut husks rather than charcoal. The table were set on the beach so you can feel the beach atmosphere while enjoy your dinner

Tour ends back to your hotel in air conditioned vehicle at 8.30  pm
strTitle: Half Day Bali Tour into Southern part of bali

strIntroduction:
People call it the most amazing waterpark in Asia, and you will spend a day in it. Let the fun times begin at Adventure Cove.

If you're into water-slides, then a zoom down the hydro-magnetic coaster is guaranteed to be a memorable experience. Here's a trivia, the coaster is the first one in South-east Asia. Continue your adventure with a trip to the stunning underwater world. Snorkelling will give you a good look at over 20,000 tropical fish over a colourful coral reef. You can also try wading to interact with dozens of rays. 

Whatever activity you choose, you will surely cherish it forever. Check out this magnificent site now.
strTitle: Visit the Fabulous Adventure Cove Waterpark with Pick-up

strTitle: Watch a Marvellous and Stunning Performance of Traditional Dances in Istanbul, Turkey

Learn the life of the Hadza Tribe in this one of a kind tour.

You will be able to learn the different ways of life of the Hadza tribe as well as their tradition and culture. Visit the thriving community and join them for their hunt of the day. Interact with the locals and enjoy a wildlife experience in the safari.

strIntroduction:
Krakow Craft Beer Tour is 3 hours walking and drinking tour through 3 local craft beer pubs in Krakow. You will 9 samples of Polish craft beers. There will also be snacks chosen to accompany the beer.
Poland is the third largest beer producer in Europe and probably one of the largest consumers. Recently Krakow has been undergoing a craft beer revolution- Unique beers from microbreweries are becoming the first choice for residents.
Since always we have been beer lovers and recently craft beers enthusiast. The chosen places are microwaves where we spend our evening. Forget about Żywiec! Join to the group of the craft beer enthusiast and discover tastes from polish microbreweries.
You can choose between tour in Old Town area or in Kazimierz district.
strTitle: Krakow Craft Beer Tour
